intro: Stenoptera montana, commonly known as the mountain stenoptera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial species. The plant is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup, often holding water. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, emerging from the leaf axils. Stenoptera montana thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
